Don't leave an exhumed corpse in the wrong place. Small-time gangsters Nicky (Ronald Cheng, Vulgaria) and Boo (Philip Ng, Once Upon A Time In Shanghai) find this out the hard way in the Wong Jing-produced horror-comedy Sifu VS Vampire, director Daniel Chan's (Triad) tribute to 80s-era Hong Kong vampire flicks.
 It is said that a corpse should be exhumed and moved every 30 years to ensure continued fortune and prosperity for its descendants. As the time limit is nearing for his grandfather's corpse, TV station boss Kelvin Chow (Kelvin Kwan, Tales from the Dark 2) looks to Charlie Jiang (Yuen Biao), whose ancestors performed the ritual for the Chow family, to complete the task.
 When Jiang refuses, citing his belief that the ritual is unethical, Chow enlists Nicky and Boo to coerce him into it. However, a series of accidents causes the corpse to be delivered to and left at Chow's TV station, unleashing a bloodbath.
